item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Will Launch This June Primarily With First-Party Titles – Rumor
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/nintendo-switch-2-launch-june-first-party-games/

The Nintendo Switch 2 is expected to launch this June, and the new system will be accompanied primarily by first-party titles, according to a new report.

Earlier today, Insider Gaming reported that during this year's GDC, there was much talk centered on the next-generation Nintendo console, which is expected to launch this June, as has been rumored for a while. The most interesting reveal, however, is regarding a three-phase games launch strategy, which will begin with a first phase featuring primarily first-party titles, followed by a second phase which should begin in October and November featuring games from third-party studios that should receive a development kit in June and a third phase that will coincide with the Holiday period.

Up until now, we have only heard rumblings and rumors regarding the Nintendo Switch 2, so it's nice to finally hear something about games, although today's report didn't provide any information regarding which games are expected to launch together with the highly-anticipated system. Thankfully, it won't be long until we will finally see something other than a new entry in the Mario Kart series running on the system, as a Nintendo Direct focused on the new system will air next week, on April 2nd. Hopefully, the presentation will also provide some information on what is expected to launch on the system beyond its release window.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows – How to Perform Guaranteed Instant Kill Assassinations
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/how-to/assassins-creed-shadows-how-to-perform-guaranteed-instant-kill-assassinations/

Unlike other entries in the series, Assassin's Creed Shadows isn't all about sneaking around and killing enemies unseen, but stealth is still a big part of the experience, especially if you like using Naoe a lot. While Yasuke can hold his own in a fight against multiple enemies, the shinobi from Iga is almost always at a disadvantage in open combat, as her toolkit is more geared towards stealth gameplay and taking down enemies without being discovered.

Unless you are equipping the best possible gear at any given time, however, Naoe is not always able to kill enemies in a single strike by approaching them silently and using the Assassination ability. Whether it's due to an enemy's high health or armor, there will be times when an Assassination attempt will result in open combat, which can be a massive issue for the young shinobi.

If you want to improve Assassin's Creed Shadows' stealth gameplay features without having to constantly hunt down the best possible gear, there's an easy way to make sure both Naoe and Yasuke will always perform lethal Assassinations. At any time during the game, enter the Options menu and access the Gameplay tab. Here, pick the Difficulty Tuning option, where you can set the Combat Difficulty and the Stealth Difficulty and turn on Guaranteed Assassinations. By turning on this option, all your successful Assassinations will automatically kill the target, regardless of the remaining health.

While turning on Guaranteed Assassination in Assassin's Creed Shadows may feel a bit like cheating for some, it is a massive game changer for stealth gameplay, as without it, the Assassination ability leaves something to be desired most of the time. With it on, however, you don't have to worry about anything else other than sneaking around and being a proper, lethal assassin!
